acknowledgments.summary: Independent researcher Karn Ganeshen identified and publicly released vulnerabilities in the Sierra Wireless AirLink Raven XE and XT Gateways prior to coordinating with ICS-CERT; however, the researcher did initially coordinate the identified vulnerabilities with the vendor.

notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov
notes.title: CISA Disclaimer

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: ATTENTION: Remotely exploitable/low skill level to exploit. Public exploits are available.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: NCCIC/ICS-CERT recommends that users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of these vulnerabilities. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: ICS-CERT reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: ICS-CERT also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available in the ICS -CERT Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies, that is available for download from the ICS-CERT web site.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to ICS-CERT for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target these vulnerabilities.
notes.title: Exploitability

document.title: Sierra Wireless AirLink Raven XE and XT

product.name: AirLink Raven XT: all versions prior to 4.0.11
AirLink Raven XE: all versions prior to 4.0.14

notes.text: Several files and directories can be accessed without authentication, which may allow a remote attacker to perform sensitive functions including arbitrary file upload, file download, and device reboot.CVE-2017-6044 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 10.0 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Sierra Wireless has released new firmware versions to address the forced browsing and cross-site request forgery vulnerabilities. Sierra Wireless reports that the insufficiently protected credentials vulnerability will not be addressed.
Sierra Wireless's Raven XE firmware Version 4.0.14
Sierra Wireless's Raven XT firmware Version 4.0.11
Sierra Wireless has released a Technical Bulletin
For additional information about these vulnerabilities or the recommendations provided, please contact Sierra Wireless' security team at security@sierrawireless.com

notes.text: Affected devices do not verify if a request was intentionally sent by the logged-in user, which may allow an attacker to trick a client into making an unintentional request to the web server that will be treated as an authentic request.CVE-2017-6042 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 8.8 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Sierra Wireless has released new firmware versions to address the forced browsing and cross-site request forgery vulnerabilities. Sierra Wireless reports that the insufficiently protected credentials vulnerability will not be addressed.
Sierra Wireless's Raven XE firmware Version 4.0.14
Sierra Wireless's Raven XT firmware Version 4.0.11
Sierra Wireless has released a Technical Bulletin
For additional information about these vulnerabilities or the recommendations provided, please contact Sierra Wireless' security team at security@sierrawireless.com

notes.text: Sensitive information is insufficiently protected during transmission and vulnerable to sniffing, which could lead to information disclosure.CVE-2017-6046 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 4.3 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Sierra Wireless has released new firmware versions to address the forced browsing and cross-site request forgery vulnerabilities. Sierra Wireless reports that the insufficiently protected credentials vulnerability will not be addressed.
Sierra Wireless's Raven XE firmware Version 4.0.14
Sierra Wireless's Raven XT firmware Version 4.0.11

For additional information about these vulnerabilities or the recommendations provided, please contact Sierra Wireless' security team at security@sierrawireless.com
